sub_title: Project and Change Management (HQ Efficiencies’ Initiative), UNICEF
summary:
I strive to make a positive change in the world; especially for the most vulnerable. 

Am a results-driven professional, an effective leader that excels in nurturing and empowering individuals and teams towards human rights, organization objectives and personal growth. I like to explore and maintain mutually beneficial relationships and partnership for social change. I am curious and look for new ideas and innovations to try and implement.

•	Conceptualized, coordinated, executed, analysed and finalised a participatory in-depth  research on adolescents and youths in juvenile gangs in Benito Juarez, Quintana Roo, Mexico in collaboration with “el Observatorio del Violencia”, Department of Family Welfare and the “University del Caribe 
•	Member of the Observatorio del Violencia de Quintana Roo – reviewed and advocated for issues such as sexual exploitation of children in the tourism industry, child gangs, (sexual) abuse and corporal punishment;
•	Developed a communication plan to address the neglect, exploitation, violence and abuse of children and life skills projects for adolescents and youth in Quintana Roo
•	Lead the participatory development of result-based M&E plans for community child rights projects
•	Conceptualized, coordinated, executed, analysed  and finalized a child participatory research on the situation of the rights of children, with a large emphasis on violence, in the Benito Juarez, Quintana Roo, Mexico with SEDESOL in collaboration with the Secretary of Education, Department of Family Welfare and two universities with more then 1400 in and out of school children (trained and supervised 34 students and a research assistant);
•	Developed a Natural Disasters Preparedness Manual with and for children, their families and child care workers in forms of a toolkit including children’s stories with the Ministry of Education for Quintana Roo and Chiapas;
